intro: Doria perfoliata, commonly known as the perfoliate doria, is a flowering plant species native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its distinctive leaves that are often perforated or joined at the base, creating a unique appearance. Doria perfoliata typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats and is adapted to high-altitude environments. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish or reddish in color.
